article_title: Hillary Clinton: It's Okay to Be a Pro-Life Feminist, But Unborn Children Still Have No Rights
article_text:
Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton finally appeared on The View today, and what she said has some people buzzing.

Clinton didn't mince words when she was asked to clarify her claim that unborn children have no rights whatsoever. She did, however, say that she thinks it's possible to be a pro-life feminist.

Here is Hillary Clinton's full exchange on @TheView about whether someone can be a feminist & pro-life: pic.twitter.com/xLhLeN3qju — Liz Kreutz (@ABCLiz) April 5, 2016

Reactions were quite varied:

Moving on... Feminism means all humans are equal. Could a man be a pro-life feminist who wants gov't to dictate a woman's body? Hells no. — Michael Salamone (@MichaelSalamone) April 5, 2016

What planet am I even on right now???? Posted by New Wave Feminists on Tuesday, April 5, 2016

article_metadata.author: Christine Rousselle

She did, however, say that she thinks it's possible to be a pro-life feminist.
Clinton didn't mince words when she was asked to clarify her claim that unborn children have no rights whatsoever.
Could a man be a pro-life feminist who wants gov't to dictate a woman's body?
Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton finally appeared on The View today, and what she said has some people buzzing.
